page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT in Thornbury
page.content:
In our area of Thornbury we noticed that an old woollen mill on Randolph St. had been taken over by a tyre company. GEC in Leeds Old Rd only has {450 people employed there }but{in 1968 {there were 5000 employees. At that time nearly 75% of the parents worked either at GEC (English Electric then!) or at Crofts, another engineering firm, or at the mill. Now there is{22% unemployment}in our area.
In our survey of 20 families{4}dads were{unemployed,}only 2 mums had jobs outside the home although 3 made soft toys at home.{Only 1 dad worked at the {engineering works}and{1 at the mill. The working dads did jobs such as:- ropemaker, plumber, policeman, bus mechanic, accountant, garden fence - maker, 3 in computing, and 1 making pencils and rubbers!
